data.title: Activist beefs up petition targeting Pheu Thai over handouts
data.description: Activist Sonthiya Sawasdee has provided additional documents to support his  petition  filed with the  Constitutional Court  against the  Pheu Thai  Party for allegedly failing to honour its  election-policy  10,000-baht digital wallet scheme.

data.title: Concerns grow over nationwide wage hike amid economic uncertainty
data.description: Thai agencies issue caution over nationwide 400 baht wage increase, citing concerns about economic impacts and risk to recovery

data.title: Five issues for Paetongtarn government
data.description: Government set to present its progress after three months in office on December 12

data.title: KTC to redefine consumer finance through digital transformation
data.description: Among the upgrades planned for 2025 are customisation of offerings, addressing fraud and developing a secure e-service platform

data.title: Green Fund Propels Saraburi’s Low-Carbon Cement Model
data.description: The Thai Cement Manufacturers Association (TCMA), in collaboration with the Thai and Canadian governments, UNIDO, and the Global Cement and Concrete Association (GCCA), has launched the ‘SARABURI SANDBOX,’ a groundbreaking low-carbon pilot project to advance sustainability in the cement and concrete industry. Supported by a green fund from Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC), this initiative is Thailand’s first regional prototype for reducing carbon emissions in its largest cement production hub.

data.title: TOAVH Restructures with Primus Group to Drive Growth
data.description: TOA Venture Holding Co ., Ltd. (TOAVH) has announced a major organisational restructuring, appointing Primus Group to oversee its auto dealership business, which represents seven major brands. This move aims to enhance operational efficiency and competitiveness.

data.title: Train services back to normal in southern Thailand Thursday
data.description: All southern trains will resume normal operations on Thursday after fatal flooding in the region damaged the tracks, forcing them to terminate at Hat Yai station.

data.title: Thais, Malaysians caught as Malaysia begins enforcing border laws
data.description: Malaysian police have made their first  arrests  since Malaysia began enforcing bans on its citizens  illegally crossing the border  into  Thailand  from  Kelantan  state.

data.title: Bangkoktellink (MVNO) Empowers Disadvantaged Groups with Free Online Access
data.description: Bangkoktellink (MVNO), a mobile network operator with a commitment to social impact, has partnered with three of Thailand’s leading government agencies to provide free internet access for disadvantaged groups, promoting online learning and self-development.

data.title: Evacuations underway as Philippine volcano erupts
data.description: A volcano erupted in the central Philippines on Monday, sending a huge ash column high into the sky as the government ordered the evacuation of surrounding villages.

data.title: How to book a tailoring session in Bangkok during your vacation
data.description: Bangkok is one of the best destinations in the world for custom tailoring, offering affordable prices, expert craftsmanship, and fast service. However, booking a tailoring session during a short vacation can seem challenging if you're unfamiliar with the process.

data.title: Police bust secret society drug bash on Sukhumvit, 124 arrested
data.description: The raid was only possible due to tip-offs, police say, adding that the secret society regularly organised such events through Instagram

data.title: Taiwan raises alert as China deploys 90 ships in likely drills
data.description: TAIPEI - Taiwan raised its alert level on Monday saying China has set up seven zones of reserved airspace and deployed naval fleets and coast guard boats in what a security source described as the first military drills across a broad swathe of the region

data.title: Korat doctor warns people in five risk groups against massage therapy
data.description: Warning follows death of woman in Udon Thani related to Thai traditional massage

data.title: Sondhi demands repeal of controversial MOU44, urges Cabinet review
data.description: Ex-PAD leader claims ‘treacherous agreement’ violates the constitution and threatens Thailand’s sovereignty over Ko Kut in Trat

data.title: Naked ambition: Russian tourist’s ambitious swim results in rescue
data.description: The tourist’s midnight swim took a wild turn when he was found naked and exhausted, drifting halfway between Pattaya and Koh Lan

data.title: 4 foreigners, 3 Thais arrested for making sex videos
data.description: Arrested foreigners include staff of well-known TukTuk Patrol channel

data.title: Royal Enfield strengthens commitment to APAC region with the inauguration of new assembly plant in Thailand
data.description: Bangkok, December 04, 2024:: Royal Enfield, global leader in mid-size (250cc-750cc) motorcycle segment, today began a new chapter in its journey in the Asia Pacific region, with the commencement of operations of its new CKD(Completely Knocked down) assembly facility in Thailand.

data.title: Former protest leader sets deadline for govt to scrap MoU with Cambodia
data.description: A group led by former yellow-shirt protest leader  Sondhi Limthongkul  arrived at Government House’s complaint centre in Bangkok on Monday and demanded the government scrap its 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) with  Cambodia  or face  demonstrations .

data.title: Youth Unite to Inspire and Support Society
data.description: In a heartfelt display of youthful compassion, talented young performers from across Thailand are coming together for the charity performance Aladdin 2024. Scheduled for Sunday, 15th December 2024, at Chiang Mai University Convention Centre, the production aims to raise funds for underprivileged and orphaned youth.

data.title: Young singer died of blood poisoning after massages
data.description: UDON THANI - A  young singer who died  after three sessions at a local  massage  parlour that included  neck twisting  had died from  blood poisoning  and an autopsy is needed to determine the actual facts of her death, the provincial health chief said on Monday.

data.title: Central Chidlom’s grand renovation | The Nation in Brief
data.description: Central Chidlom’s grand renovation is more than just a facelift—it’s a masterclass in retail strategy. As Thailand’s most consistently high-performing department store, Central Chidlom's transformation is poised to reinforce its status as a world-class luxury destination.

data.title: Starbucks Reserve™  One Bangkok | The Nation Lifestyle
data.description: Today, we’re thrilled to present the unveiling of Starbucks' newest Flagship Store and its largest Greener Store at One Bangkok, a prestigious location in the heart of the city.

data.title: Contractor loses millions for abandoning Trang terminal project
data.description: Airports Department seizes 53-million-baht security deposit after contractor abandons construction, will search for a replacement soon to meet March deadline

data.title: Mitr Phol Group recognized with the Human Rights Award for the 5th consecutive year
data.description: Highlighting its commitment to conducting business in alignment with international human rights principles

data.title: Phillip Securities acquires RHB, boosting revenue 50%, offering 20 markets.
data.description: Phillip Securities Thailand has closed a major deal to acquire RHB Securities Thailand, strengthening its stock brokerage business. The merger is expected to boost revenue by more than 50% while expanding services and client base amid challenging conditions in Thailand's capital market.

data.title: Booming industries, skills gaps sparking Thai talent war: survey
data.description: Annual salary survey by Robert Walters says demand is highest in food manufacturing, fast-moving consumer goods, and automotive sectors

data.title: 23 Thais still in Syria, people rejoice as Assad flees
data.description: A number of Thai citizens in Syria have decided to stay in that country to evaluate the situation before deciding whether they would return home.
